DialogueOption.Text: There's someone I'd like you to meet.

Dialogue.Page: How do you understand my language?
He didn't like his name much, sounded too much like "xylophone".
Mother named him Xylo because it meant "wood". It fits, because he was hearty, strong, and determined. Like a bundle of wood.
Then came me, the younger brother, Phyllo. Meaning "leaf", they named me that because I was soft, but had a big heart.
When I found out he crashed on that planet, I was devastated. I was lost without him.
And now here I am, locked up for eternity hoping the atoms of our terror turned into a bustling, new universe.
Say, there's someone you want me to meet?

DialogueOption.Text: You have a distant grandnephew waiting for you.

Dialogue.Page: I'm an uncle again? Did Xylo....

DialogueOption.Text: Yep, he terraformed home. It's as good as new.

Dialogue.Page: If only I could see our home again...*sniff*

DialogueOption.Text: I'll take you to him. Follow me!

Dialogue.Page: Alright, blue friend. Lead the way!
